9#What causes populations to adapt or evolve? ##Students can make multi-media presentations about the evidence that the process of evolution primarily results from four factors: (1) the potential for a species to increase in number, (2) the heritable genetic variation of individuals in a species due to mutation and sexual reproduction, (3) competition for limited resources, and (4) the proliferation of those organisms that are better able to survive and reproduce in the environment.#Why do some living things survive and reproduce, while others do not?#‘What causes populations to adapt or evolve?’ #Obtaining, Evaluating, and Communicating Information (9-12): Communicate scientific and/or technical information or ideas (e.g. about phenomena and/or the process of development and the design and performance of a proposed process or system) in multiple formats (including orally, graphically, textually, and mathematically).#Examples of classroom activities could include evaluating questions about the process of evolution to determine whether they are testable or relevant, and constructing explanations about the influence that each of the four factors has on number of organisms, behaviors, morphology, or physiology in terms of ability to compete for limited resources and subsequent survival of individuals and adaptation of species. ####
